alert.note: Alert for Big Island North; Kohala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 02 at 3:04AM HST until March 02 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FOR KAUAI OAHU MAUI COUNTY AND MOST OF THE BIG ISLAND THROUGH 6 PM THIS EVENING... ...THE HIGH WIND WARNING FOR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE BIG ISLAND HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A WIND ADVISORY... .Robust high pressure far north of the state will continue to produce strong and gusty trade winds. Isolated pockets of warning level wind gusts are expected in the Kohala Districts of the Big Island, where a High Wind Warning remains in place through tonight. The Wind Advisory will likely be extended for portions of the state on Thursday. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...East winds 20 to 30 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph. * WHERE...The northern portion of the Big Island over and leeward of the Kohala mountains. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can knock down tree branches, blow away tents and unsecured objects, and make it difficult to drive, particularly for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
